questions.question: In this experiment, what role does LoRaWAN play?

answers.a: Transmitting sensor data over long distances

explanations.a: Correct. LoRaWAN is used to transmit data over long ranges with low power. More info
explanations.b: Incorrect. LoRaWAN does not provide internet browsing.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Local applications are handled by the microcontroller.
explanations.d: Incorrect. GPS is a separate technology.

questions.question: Why is ESP8266/ESP32 suitable for IoT applications?

answers.a: It has built-in Wi-Fi and can interface with LoRa modules
answers.b: It has a high-end graphics processor
answers.c: It works without any power supply
answers.d: It can only store large multimedia files

explanations.a: Correct. ESP8266/ESP32 supports Wi-Fi and can work with LoRa for IoT projects. Learn more
explanations.b: Incorrect. Graphics processing is not its purpose.
explanations.d: Incorrect. It is not designed for multimedia storage.

questions.question: What is a key benefit of using LoRaWAN in rural IoT projects?

answers.a: It covers long distances with minimal power usage
answers.c: It allows online gaming in remote areas

explanations.a: Correct. LoRaWANâ€™s long range and low power make it ideal for rural monitoring. See details
explanations.b: Incorrect. LoRaWAN is not made for video streaming.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Gaming is not its target application.
explanations.d: Incorrect. LoRaWAN is unrelated to satellite TV.

questions.question: In this experiment, where is the collected sensor data sent after reaching the gateway?

answers.a: To a cloud platform for storage and visualization

explanations.a: Correct. The gateway forwards data to a cloud platform for analysis. Read more
explanations.b: Incorrect. A printer is not used in data storage.
explanations.c: Incorrect. USB drives are not part of LoRaWAN cloud systems.
